objects.name: Scout Tank
objects.description: A tank class optimized for mobility and rapid firing capability, designed for hit-and-run tactics.
objects.special_rules: High DPS multiplier (×1.472 when maxed), prioritizes Fire Rate and Speed upgrades.
objects.source_note: CONTEXT: Scout (cơ động ‒ dồn nhịp bắn) section.

objects.name: Assault Tank
objects.description: A balanced tank class designed for mid-game carry roles with moderate survivability and damage output.
objects.special_rules: DPS multiplier ×1.459 when maxed, higher HP compared to Scout for sustained combat.
objects.source_note: CONTEXT: Assault (toàn diện ‒ nhịp giao tranh chính) section.

objects.name: Heavy Tank
objects.description: A tank class focused on durability and frontline control, with lower DPS but the highest EHP.
objects.special_rules: DPS multiplier ×1.379 when maxed, EHP increased by 29.4%.
objects.source_note: CONTEXT: Heavy (chống chịu ‒ giữ tuyến) section.

systems.name: In-Match Tank Upgrade System
systems.description: A system allowing players to upgrade tank stats during a match to adapt to evolving combat scenarios.
systems.mechanics: Players can upgrade four stats (HP, SPD, DMG, FR) up to three levels each, with diminishing returns applied.
systems.objectives: Enhance tactical depth and adaptability in matches by enabling stat optimization based on player strategy.
interactions: Players spend in-match rewards (gold, XP) to unlock upgrades.
Upgrades reset after the match ends.
systems.source_note: CONTEXT: Tổng quan hệ thống and related sections.

logic_rules.description: Each subsequent upgrade level provides a smaller percentage increase than the previous one.
logic_rules.trigger: Player selects an upgrade for a specific stat.
logic_rules.effect: The cumulative bonus is calculated using a multiplicative stacking formula, resulting in reduced effectiveness per level.
logic_rules.source_note: CONTEXT: Quy tắc stack and related examples.

logic_rules.description: Different tank classes receive varying benefits from stat upgrades based on their roles.
logic_rules.trigger: Player selects an upgrade for a specific stat.
logic_rules.effect: Stats are weighted differently for each class to align with their intended playstyle (e.g., Scouts prioritize FR, Heavies prioritize HP).
logic_rules.source_note: CONTEXT: Nguyên tắc thiết kế section.

requirements.title: Balanced Upgrade System
requirements.description: Ensure that the in-match upgrade system provides meaningful choices without making any single stat overpowered.
requirements.acceptance_criteria: All tank classes must maintain balanced performance across different upgrade paths.
requirements.source_note: CONTEXT: Nguyên tắc thiết kế and related sections.

requirements.title: Implement Diminishing Returns
requirements.description: Apply diminishing returns to stat upgrades to prevent excessive power scaling.
requirements.acceptance_criteria: Cumulative bonuses must follow the multiplicative stacking formula and reflect diminishing returns.
requirements.source_note: CONTEXT: Quy tắc stack and related examples.

requirements.title: Align Upgrades with Class Roles
requirements.description: Ensure that stat upgrades complement the intended roles of each tank class.
requirements.acceptance_criteria: Scouts emphasize FR and SPD, Assaults balance all stats, and Heavies focus on HP.
requirements.source_note: CONTEXT: Các thuộc tính được phép nâng cấp and related sections.
